Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.belotserkovchenko.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.belotserkovchenko.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements JarImpler
Implementation of JarImpler interface generating classes with methods returning default values.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Generates an implementation of specified class or interface according to passed arguments. The method can take one command line argument - the full name of class/interface for which you want to generate an implementation, in the format: 
           java <class name>
      Use -jar to generate .jar file with implementation of specified class. Use the following format: 
           java -jar <class name> <jar-file>
      For generation, the implement(Class, Path) and implementJar(Class, Path) methods are used respectively. Displays an error message if the class cannot be found or ImplerException was thrown while during the call of implement(Class, Path) and implementJar(Class, Path) methods.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar​(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: JarImpler
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • implement

      public void implement​(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: Impler
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • deleteDir

      private static void deleteDir​(Path directory) throws ImplerException
      Recursively deletes a folder with all its contents.
      Parameters:
      directory - the path to folder to delete
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if IOException occurs while deleting files

    • compile

      private static void compile​(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Compiles the specified class and places to the given directory.
      Parameters:
      token - type token of class we need to compile.
      root - directory we need to place result .class file to.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if exit code is not equal to 0 during compilation.

    • getClassPath

      private static String getClassPath​(Class<?> token)
      Returns a String representation of the absolute classpath.
      Parameters:
      token - type token to get classpath for.
      Returns:
      classpath to specified type token

    • getFile

      private static Path getFile​(Path root, Class<?> clazz, String suffix)
      Returns the Path to the class being implemented.
      Parameters:
      root - the directory where the class implementation should be
      clazz - type token of the class being implemented
      suffix - file suffix, for example .class or .java
      Returns:
      Path to the file with specified suffix

    • getImplName

      private static String getImplName​(Class<?> token)
      Returns canonical name of class implementation. Name of result class always ends with Impl suffix
      Parameters:
      token - type token of the class being implemented
      Returns:
      canonical name of implementation.

    • checkToken

      private void checkToken​(Class<?> token) throws ImplerException
      Checks if a class can be implemented. In case the class is primitive, private, final, enum or class without available constructors, the ImplerException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      token - type token of verifiable class
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if class can't be implemented

    • joining

      private static <T> String joining​(T[] arr, Function<T,​String> function)
      Returns the result of executing function on array elements separated by commas.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of processed objects
      Parameters:
      arr - array of processed objects
      function - function applied on array elements
      Returns:
      String with results

    • writeClass

      private void writeClass​(Class<?> token, String className, BufferedWriter bw) throws IOException
      Writes class to specified BufferedWriter. Including package, class modifiers, constructors and methods.
      Parameters:
      token - type token of the class being implemented
      className - implementation class name
      bw - output BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O Exception occurs while writing to bw

    • writeMethodImpl

      private void writeMethodImpl​(int modifiers, Class<?> returnType, String methodName, Parameter[] args, Class<?>[] exceptions, String body, BufferedWriter bw) throws IOException
      Writes method with given attributes to specified BufferedWriter.
      Parameters:
      modifiers - set of modifiers represented as integer
      returnType - method return type
      methodName - method name
      args - method arguments
      exceptions - method exceptions
      body - the inner part of the method, for example return new Int[0][][]; or super();
      bw - output BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O Exception occurs while writing to bw
      See Also:
      Modifier

    • writeConstructor

      private void writeConstructor​(Constructor<?> c, String className, BufferedWriter bw) throws IOException
      Writes given constructor to specified BufferedWriter. The result constructor only contains a call to the superclass constructor.
      Parameters:
      c - class constructor
      className - the name of the implemented class
      bw - output BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O Exception occurs while writing to bw

    • writeMethod

      private void writeMethod​(Method m, BufferedWriter bw) throws IOException
      Writes given method to specified BufferedWriter. The result method only contains return of default value for method return type: null for Objects, empty arrays for arrays, false for boolean, 0 for numerical types and nothing for void.
      Parameters:
      m - class method
      bw - output BufferedWriter
      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O Exception occurs while writing to bw
